intro: Anisocentra, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and southern Europe. Anisocentra species typically have finely divided leaves and produce small, yellow or white flowers. They are often used in traditional medicine and as ornamental plants due to their resilience and aesthetic appeal.
